faq.title: Have questions about working with us?

items.question: How long does the selection process take?
items.answer: The complete process usually takes between 2-3 weeks from receiving your application to the final offer. We strive to maintain fluid communication at each stage.

items.question: What documents do I need to apply?
items.answer: You need to send your updated CV. If you have a cover letter, portfolio or relevant certifications, you can also attach them to enrich your application.

items.question: Do you offer remote or hybrid work?
items.answer: Yes, we offer flexibility in the work modality. Depending on the position and project needs, you can work remotely, hybrid or in-person at our offices.

items.question: What is the work environment like at NRRO?
items.answer: We promote a collaborative and professional environment where we value excellence, teamwork and continuous development. We believe in the balance between personal and professional life.

items.question: What professional growth opportunities do you offer?
items.answer: We have personalized career plans, continuous training and real opportunities for internal promotion. Your professional development is important to us.

items.question: Do you offer training programs?
items.answer: Yes, we invest in the continuous training of our team with access to courses, certifications, conferences and workshops specialized in the latest technologies and methodologies.

items.question: What are the working hours?
items.answer: We offer flexible schedules that adapt to the needs of the team and projects. We value productivity and results over strict hours.

items.question: Is there a probation period?
items.answer: Yes, according to Spanish legislation we apply a probation period that varies depending on the type of contract and position. During this time, we mutually evaluate if there is a good professional fit.

items.question: Can I apply if I have no experience?
items.answer: Depending on the position, we consider junior candidates with potential and eagerness to learn. We highly value attitude, commitment and development capacity.

items.question: How do I stay informed about new opportunities?
items.answer: You can regularly check our open positions section or send us your spontaneous application. We keep interesting profiles for future opportunities.

whatIs.title: Special Tax Regime for Expats
whatIs.p1: The Beckham Law is a special tax regime designed to attract international talent to Spain.
whatIs.p2: It allows professionals who transfer their residence to Spain to be taxed as non-residents for a maximum period of 6 years, applying a fixed rate of 24% on employment income obtained in Spain.
whatIs.p3: This regime represents significant tax savings compared to the general progressive income tax scale, which can reach up to 47% in some autonomous communities.

requirements.title: Can you apply for the Beckham Law?
requirements.subtitle: Check if you meet the necessary requirements to benefit from this regime

req1.title: Not having been a tax resident in Spain
req1.description: You must not have been a tax resident in Spain during the 10 years prior to the transfer

req2.title: Transfer for work reasons
req2.description: The move to Spain must occur as a result of an employment contract, appointment as director, or start of economic activity

req3.title: Become a tax resident in Spain
req3.description: You must acquire tax residence in Spain according to income tax criteria (more than 183 days per year or center of economic interests)

req4.title: Work performed in Spanish territory
req4.description: Work must be effectively performed in Spain for a company or entity established in Spanish territory

req5.title: Application within deadline
req5.description: You must submit the application within 6 months following the start of your work activity in Spain

req6.title: Not conducting activities through a Permanent Establishment
req6.description: If you're a business owner or professional, you can't conduct your activity through a permanent establishment that was already in Spain before your transfer

req7.title: Employment contract or appointment
req7.description: You need to have an employment contract, be appointed as a company director, or start an economic activity in Spain

req8.title: Not in incompatibility situations
req8.description: You cannot be in specific situations that the law considers incompatible with this regime

faq.title: Questions about the Beckham Law
faq.subtitle: Answers to the most common questions about the expat regime
faq.q1: What exactly is the Beckham Law?
faq.a1: It's a special tax regime that allows professionals who transfer their residence to Spain to be taxed as non-residents for a maximum of 6 years, applying a fixed rate of 24% on employment income obtained in Spain, instead of the general progressive income tax scale that can reach up to 47%.
faq.q2: How long can I benefit from the Beckham Law?
faq.a2: You can apply for this regime during the tax period in which you acquire tax residence in Spain and the following 5 tax periods, which represents a maximum of 6 complete calendar years.
faq.q3: What types of income are taxed at 24%?
faq.a3: The 24% rate applies to employment and business income obtained in Spain up to ‚Ç¨600,000. Above this amount, the rate is 47%. Capital income and capital gains are taxed at 19-26% according to non-resident regulations.
faq.q4: Do I have to pay taxes on my foreign income?
faq.a4: No. One of the main advantages of the Beckham Law is that you'll only pay taxes on Spanish-sourced income. Income obtained abroad (dividends, interest, rent, etc.) is exempt from taxation in Spain, although you must declare it as exempt income.
faq.q5: When should I submit the application?
faq.a5: You must submit the application (form 149) within 6 months from the start of your work activity in Spain. It's essential to meet this deadline because otherwise you'll lose the possibility of applying for the regime.
faq.q6: Can I apply if I've already been in Spain for some time?
faq.a6: No. One of the requirements is not having been a tax resident in Spain during the previous 10 years. If you're already a resident, you cannot apply for this regime. It's important to plan the transfer in advance.
faq.q7: What if I work for a foreign company?
faq.a7: You can apply for the regime as long as the work is effectively performed in Spanish territory and for companies or entities resident in Spain. If you work remotely for a foreign company, the situation is more complex and must be analyzed case by case.
faq.q8: Can I be a company director and apply for the regime?
faq.a8: Yes, the regime allows those appointed as directors of entities in Spain to apply, as long as they meet the other requirements. It's a widely used option by international executives and entrepreneurs.
